text: Hi! we just published a boilerplate for a :vuejs: *Vue.js* + typescript HubSpot module, following the great work HubSpot did with the cms-react-app. It comes with everything ready for setting up a local environment with npm, and a `docker-compose.yml` with a Makefile so you just need to run `make` to build the container and install npm packages. You can find everything at the module's github page <https://github.com/sparkfabrik/HubSpot-cms-vuejs-typescript-boilerplate>. We await your feedback!

Very interested in how you used docker... Embarrassingly I've never used docker but have been meaning to look into to help our build. Could you give a high level of what you're using Docker to do here (keeping in mind I know very little about it)?
hi <@UJQNNKKHN>! really simple, we used a Node container because we wanted to have a node runtime with yarn to build and run everything without having to worry about local dependencies
also I don't like to deal with different node or npm versions locally so every project has its own docker container
hi <@U017K50TYE8>, just in case you missed it I leave a link to this post here hoping it will interest you! <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CM9UXHWKH/p1595600264172500>
